body:
Context We are replacing Nautilus with Thunar to align with the "Zero-Drag" philosophy (lightweight, fast). We need to remove competing file managers, apply the system theme, and configure developer-centric custom actions.

Instructions for Copilot Please generate the code/scripts to perform the following:

1. Package Management (Arch)

Install:

thunar (Core)

thunar-archive-plugin (Right-click -> Extract)

thunar-volman (USB auto-mount)

file-roller (Backend for archives)

gvfs (Trash and mounting support)

catppuccin-gtk-theme-mocha (Theming)

papirus-icon-theme (Clean folder icons)

Remove:

nautilus
dolphin (if present)
any other alt competing file manager

2. System Integration

Default File Manager: Set Thunar as the default for opening folders: xdg-mime default thunar.desktop inode/directory

Hyprland Keybind: Update ~/.config/hypr/hyprland.conf: Change bind = $mainMod, E, ... to exec, thunar

Theme Application: Generate a command to force the dark theme (GTK settings): gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.interface gtk-theme "Catppuccin-Mocha-Standard-Blue-Dark" gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.interface icon-theme "Papirus-Dark"

3. Configure Custom Actions (~/.config/Thunar/uca.xml)

Generate the uca.xml file with these essential Developer Actions:

"Open in VS Code"

Command: code %f

Icon: visual-studio-code

"Open in Kitty"

Command: kitty --directory %f

Icon: kitty

"Copy Path"

Command: echo -n %f | wl-copy

Icon: edit-copy

Definition of Done:

Super + E opens Thunar instantly.

Thunar is dark and matches the Catppuccin Mocha palette.

Right-clicking a folder shows "Open in VS Code" and "Open in Kitty".

Nautilus is removed from the system.
title: Refactor: Replace Nautilus with Thunar (Theme, Keybinds & Custom Actions)
